carousel_items: Promethazine comes in different forms. Be clear on which one you were prescribed - swallow tablets orally, unwrap and insert suppositories rectally.
Don't give to kids 2 and under.
You'll likely feel very sleepy, sluggish, or less alert after taking Promethazine. Avoid driving or other tasks that require your focused attention; be safe.
Don't drink alcohol to avoid intense side effects.
Taking certain medications for pain, allergies, or mood conditions can worsen the side effects of Promethazine.
Avoid using if you experience seizures (epilepsy).
Don't use if you're 65 or older because you're at higher risk for serious side effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Promethazine is an antihistamine, which helps control allergies. It also seems to block your body's natural reflex for vomiting, which makes it useful as an antiemetic (anti-nausea medicine).
basics.bottom_line: Promethazine is used to treat and prevent nausea and vomiting from surgery, motion sickness, or pregnancy. While it's cheap and available in different forms to make it easier to take, it can make you feel very sleepy, and its side effects mean that children under 2 and adults over 65 shouldn't take it.
downsides: Can make you feel very sleepy, especially if you're taking other drugs that can make you sleepy or if you drink alcohol.
Can't be used in children under 2 years of age or if you're over 65 because of increased risk from side effects.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.

downsides_processed.orig: Can make you feel very sleepy, especially if you're taking other drugs that can make you sleepy or if you drink alcohol.
Can't be used in children under 2 years of age or if you're over 65 because of increased risk from side effects.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.

upsides: Available as a syrup or tablet that you can take by mouth, or as a rectal suppository if you're unable to take anything by mouth.

upsides_processed.orig: Available as a syrup or tablet that you can take by mouth, or as a rectal suppository if you're unable to take anything by mouth.

userStories.tip: It makes you very sleepy, but that was a welcome side effect.

drugs.name: Phenergan

carousel_items_processed.orig: Promethazine comes in different forms. Be clear on which one you were prescribed - swallow tablets orally, unwrap and insert suppositories rectally.
Don't give to kids 2 and under.
You'll likely feel very sleepy, sluggish, or less alert after taking Promethazine. Avoid driving or other tasks that require your focused attention; be safe.
Don't drink alcohol to avoid intense side effects.
Taking certain medications for pain, allergies, or mood conditions can worsen the side effects of Promethazine.
Avoid using if you experience seizures (epilepsy).
Don't use if you're 65 or older because you're at higher risk for serious side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing or stopping of breathing
risks_warnings.description: It's not recommended for children and teenagers, especially under the age of 2, to take Promethazine. There are reports of children whose breathing has slowed down after taking Promethazine, and some have died, especially if they were taking other medications that also slow down breathing.

description_processed.orig: It's not recommended for children and teenagers, especially under the age of 2, to take Promethazine. There are reports of children whose breathing has slowed down after taking Promethazine, and some have died, especially if they were taking other medications that also slow down breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: If you've ever had seizures, taking Promethazine can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern, or if you're taking medications to control your seizures since they may need to change the dose.

description_processed.orig: If you've ever had seizures, taking Promethazine can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern, or if you're taking medications to control your seizures since they may need to change the dose.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: Taking Promethazine can make your skin more sensitive to the sun, and more likely to have sunburn. Avoid being out in the sun for extended periods of time, or wear sunblock or protective clothing if you have to be out.

description_processed.orig: Taking Promethazine can make your skin more sensitive to the sun, and more likely to have sunburn. Avoid being out in the sun for extended periods of time, or wear sunblock or protective clothing if you have to be out.

risks_warnings.title: Involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor right away if you find that you're unable to control your movements (tremors, jerky movements of your arms or legs while walking, trouble swallowing or talking) while you're on Promethazine.  Your nervous system can be affected by taking this medication, especially if you're taking it for a long time. This is very rare.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor right away if you find that you're unable to control your movements (tremors, jerky movements of your arms or legs while walking, trouble swallowing or talking) while you're on Promethazine.  Your nervous system can be affected by taking this medication, especially if you're taking it for a long time. This is very rare.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Promethazine who have developed a condition called neuroleptic malignant syndrome. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you develop a very high fever, your muscles become very stiff, an irregular pulse, or a lot of sweating.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people taking Promethazine who have developed a condition called neuroleptic malignant syndrome. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you develop a very high fever, your muscles become very stiff, an irregular pulse, or a lot of sweating.

points.notes: Contraindicated for pediatric patients because of this side effect
points.name: Respiratory depression
insomnia
points.hlt: disturbances in initiating and maintaining sleep

carousel_items: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

drugs.one_liner: Treats ADHD and lowers blood pressure.
drugs.name: Kapvay

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
For ADHD: Might take up to 2 weeks to see effects.
For high blood pressure: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal (rebound hypertension)
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.
risk_factors: Using other medicine(s) that slows the heart

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure (hypotension)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

description_processed.orig: Clonidine can lower your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure in the first week of taking Clonidine. Let your doctor know if you continue to feel dizzy after 1 week of use.

carousel_items: Take it with food to avoid getting diarrhea.
Don't drink alcohol while using Toradol.
Don't take other anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) without talking to your doctor or pharmacist.
Can cause swelling in your legs, abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, and an upset stomach.
Don't take antacids with magnesium since they can interact with Toradol.
Take Toradol at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to prevent an increased risk of heart attack.

basics.benefits_moa: Toradol is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It stops your body from making chemicals that cause inflammation and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Toradol is an okay medication for some types of short-term pain, but don't take it for longer than you really need it.
downsides: Causes increased risk of stomach bleeding, heart attack, and strokes, so you shouldn't take it long-term.
Interacts with a lot of other medications.

downsides_processed.orig: Causes increased risk of stomach bleeding, heart attack, and strokes, so you shouldn't take it long-term.
Interacts with a lot of other medications.

upsides: Treat pain and inflammation caused by a variety of medical problems including arthritis, menstrual cramps, and other types of short-term pain.

upsides_processed.orig: Treat pain and inflammation caused by a variety of medical problems including arthritis, menstrual cramps, and other types of short-term pain.

drugs.name: ketorolac

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it with food to avoid getting diarrhea.
Don't drink alcohol while using Toradol.
Don't take other anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) without talking to your doctor or pharmacist.
Can cause swelling in your legs, abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, and an upset stomach.
Don't take antacids with magnesium since they can interact with Toradol.
Take Toradol at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to prevent an increased risk of heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Toradol can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Toradol during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Toradol can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Toradol during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Toradol can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Toradol can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Toradol, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Toradol for long periods of time.

description_processed.orig: Toradol, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Toradol for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Toradol. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Toradol. Don't take Toradol while using other blood thinning medications, such as aspirin or ibuprofen, unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Toradol. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Toradol. Don't take Toradol while using other blood thinning medications, such as aspirin or ibuprofen, unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Toradol can negatively affect fetal blood circulation and inhibit uterine contractions, so it shouldn't be used during pregnancy or labor and delivery.

description_processed.orig: Toradol can negatively affect fetal blood circulation and inhibit uterine contractions, so it shouldn't be used during pregnancy or labor and delivery.

carousel_items: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

clock.tip: Works faster and stronger when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

downsides_processed.orig: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

upsides: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

drugs.name: Neurontin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

carousel_items: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

basics.benefits_moa: Diclofenac sodium is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diclofenac sodium works well for pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

upsides: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to relieve pain and inflammation from osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.
Good for muscle aches and pains.
May treat arthritis pain better than other similar medicines (NSAIDs).
Can cause less upset stomach than other NSAIDs like ibuprofen (Advil).
It's also available as a gel that you put on your skin. If it's hard for you to swallow pills, this could be a good option.
If you're only using the gel, you won't have the same side effects that you would while taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

userStories.tip: Took Diclofenac SOD for CPPD (Inflammatory arthritis) for yrs before bilateral knee replacements. 3yrs later, I'm having swelling/pain after golf/long walks/workouts.  Meloxicam didn't help so asked for Diclofenac.  It still works for me!

userStories.identifier: Male with occasionally severe back pain
userStories.tip: My doctor prescribed Voltaren because he has completely undue fears of VicoProfen, but while VicoProfen works exceptionally well, Voltaren has no detectable effect on my pain.
If you feel dizzy, bring it up to your doctor.  Mine lowered the dosage and it helped a lot!

drugs.name: Voltaren

carousel_items_processed.orig: If taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth, take it with a meal or a snack to prevent an upset stomach.
Can cause stomach ulcers, especially if taking it by mouth often.
Can make you bruise or bleed more easily. You shouldn't take any other 'blood thinner' medications unless your doctor tells you it's safe.
Don't use it the first two weeks after a heart surgery.
Can affect your kidneys' ability to work as well.

If using the skin (topical) gel, use the dosing card it comes with to make sure you measure the correct dose. You also won't have many of the same side effects that you would if taking Diclofenac sodium by mouth.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Diclofenac sodium during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Diclofenac sodium. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Diclofenac sodium. Don't take Diclofenac sodium while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Diclofenac sodium can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Diclofenac sodium and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Diclofenac sodium for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Diclofenac sodium can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Diclofenac sodium can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.
